caption:
Table 1: Statistics of the RWTH-PHOENIX-Weather 2014T and ASLG-PC12 datasets. Out-of-
vocabulary (OOV) words are those that appear in the development and testing sets, but not in the training 
set. Singletons are words that appear only once during training.
Table 2: Statistics of the ASLG-PC12 dataset before and after preprocessing.

Table 3: G2T performance comparison of Transformers on PHOENIX-Weather 2014T with different 
number of enc-dec layers.
Table 4: German and English pre-trained embeddings statistics

Table 5: G2T performance comparison using different embedding schemes on PHOENIX-Weather 
2014T.
Table 6: G2T performance comparison using different embedding schemes on ASLG-PC12.
Table 7: G2T on PHEONIX-WEATHER 2014T final results.
Table 8: G2T on ASLG-PC12 final results

Table 9: SLT performance using STMC for CSLR. The first set of rows correspond to the current state-
of-the-arts included for comparison.
